content: Was Napoleon Bonaparte really short, as often portrayed in popular culture?

Actually, the idea that Napoleon Bonaparte was short is a bit of a misconception. He was often portrayed as short in popular culture, but historical records suggest that he was actually of average height for his time. In French units, his height was recorded as 5 feet 2 inches, but when converted to modern English units, that would be about 5 feet 7 inches, which was average height for a man in the late 18th century. So, the myth of Napoleon being short seems to have originated from a misinterpretation of height measurements and some political caricatures from his time.
